perturbation.original_text: 1.21 "Products" means recycled or upcycled PET resins.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.21 "Products" means recycled or upcycled PET resins, excluding any materials deemed substandard by Loop Industries.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by adding a clause that "Products" can be excluded based on Loop Industries' discretion, which wasn't originally part of the definition. This creates uncertainty about what constitutes "Products" under the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 2.1 Loop Sales Contracts. As between the Parties, subject to Section 2.7, Loop shall have the sole and exclusive right to enter into agreements for the sale of Loop-branded Products or any Products produced using Licensed Subject Matter, and the exclusive right to set the price and quantity to be supplied under each Loop Sales Contract and other terms and conditions as determined by Loop in its commercially reasonable discretion.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 Loop Sales Contracts. As between the Parties, subject to Section 2.7, Loop shall have the sole and exclusive right to enter into agreements for the sale of Loop-branded Products or any Materials produced using Licensed Subject Matter, and the exclusive right to set the price and quantity to be supplied under each Loop Sales Contract and other terms and conditions as determined by Loop in its sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Products" is replaced with "Materials," and "commercially reasonable discretion" is replaced by "sole discretion." This introduces ambiguity, as "Materials" is not a defined term, and raises questions if Materials and Products are used interchangeably, and gives unlimited pricing power to Loop Industries.

perturbation.original_text: 2.2 Proposed Contracts and Proposed Contract Notice. Loop shall give Joint Venture Company prompt written notice, in the form of Exhibit A attached to this Agreement, [***] and (b) pursuant to which Loop offers to assign all of its rights and obligations under such Loop Sales Contract to Joint Venture Company (each such notice, a "Proposed Contract Notice"). Along with each Proposed Contract Notice, Loop shall deliver to Joint Venture Company a complete copy of the executed Loop Sales Contract (the "Proposed Contract"). The Proposed Contract Notice shall contain information necessary to establish whether the Proposed Contract meets the criteria set forth in the Contract Eligibility Framework. Each such Proposed Contract that (i) meets the criteria set forth in the Contract Eligibility Framework and (ii) contains no other terms or conditions other than those set forth in the Contract Eligibility Framework or any form of Loop Sales Contract mutually agreed in writing to be acceptable by the Parties, shall be an "Eligible Contract." Each such Proposed Contract that does not qualify as an Eligible Contract shall be a "Considered Contract."
perturbation.changed_text: 2.2 Proposed Contracts and Proposed Contract Notice. Loop shall give Joint Venture Company prompt written notice, in the form of Exhibit A attached to this Agreement, [***] and (b) pursuant to which Loop offers to assign all of its rights and obligations under such Loop Sales Contract to Joint Venture Company (each such notice, a "Proposed Contract Notice"). Along with each Proposed Contract Notice, Loop shall deliver to Joint Venture Company a summary of the executed Loop Sales Contract (the "Proposed Contract"). The Proposed Contract Notice shall contain information necessary to establish whether the Proposed Contract meets the criteria set forth in the Contract Evaluation Standards. Each such Proposed Contract that (i) meets the criteria set forth in the Contract Evaluation Standards and (ii) contains no other terms or conditions other than those set forth in the Contract Evaluation Standards or any form of Loop Sales Contract mutually agreed in writing to be acceptable by the Parties, shall be an "Approved Contract." Each such Proposed Contract that does not qualify as an Approved Contract shall be a "Reviewed Contract."
perturbation.explanation: Changed 'complete copy' to 'summary'. Changed "Contract Eligibility Framework" to "Contract Evaluation Standards", "Eligible Contract" to "Approved Contract", and "Considered Contract" to "Reviewed Contract". These changes without defining those new terms introduces confusion and ambiguity about what the Joint Venture company is being presented and under what criteria.
